title: Button

<p className="leading-snug text-xl">
  The Button is the base interactive component for{' '}
  <em>demo-library</em>: it affords navigation, form submission, and application
  state changes.
</p>

Three variations of Button exist to demonstrate the level of interaction: primary, secondary, and tertiary.

```tsx preview
<div className="flex items-center">
  <div className="mr-3">
    <Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
  </div>
  <div className="mr-3">
    <Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
  </div>
  <Button variant="tertiary">Tertiary</Button>
</div>
```

### Related

* [Interaction and feedback 竊余(#)
* [Design specifications 竊余(#)

## Usage

Import the `Button` component into a React component in your project:

```tsx
import {Button} from 'demo-library';
```

Use Button by passing it `children` and an `onClick` handler in your React component:

```tsx
import React from 'react'
import {Button} from 'demo-library';

export const MyComponent: React.FC<any> = () => {
  return (
    <Button
      onClick={(event) => {
        console.log('Clicked!', event)
      }}
    >
      My Button
    </Button>
  )
}
```

## Variants

`Button` comes with three variations, set through the `variant` property:

### Primary

Use the primary variant for call to action, form submission, dialog or modal
trigger.

```tsx live
<Button>Primary button</Button>
```

### Secondary

```tsx live
<Button variant="secondary">Secondary button</Button>
```

### Tertiary

```tsx live
<Button variant="tertiary">Tertiary button</Button>
```

## Accessibility

The `Button` component has a `role="button`" property provided. Ensure that the
element has the appropriate role for its use:

* `role="submit"` for a form submission button
* `role="reset"` for a form reset button

### Related

* ["Building Accessible Buttons with ARIA" on Deque 竊余(https://www.deque.com/blog/accessible-aria-buttons/)
* ["ARIA: button role" on MDN 竊余(https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/button_role/)
